page.title: 02WIGMORE CASTLE
page.content:
WIGMORE CASTLE
The remains of Wigmore Castle which stand above the village to the West are those of the Norman Castle built in 1067. There had been an earlier castle standing on Green Hill, midway between the ruins and the village. The ruins still show signs of their Norman structure. The castle was a formidable fortress giving protection against the Welsh. The Mortimer family, who owned it during much of the Medieval period, flourished and the Castle was often used to host royal visits. Edward IV when Duke of York, stayed there, and marched from the Castle to the battle of Mortimer's Cross, which he won on 2nd February 1461. The last person born in the castle was Sir Edward Harley in 1624.
